JOB REQUIREMENTS:

These are the minimum job requirements for entry at the Grid 18 level. Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below. Initial level placement and movement along the continuum is based upon individual assessment of skill, competencies, and experience. Refer to the attached job profile for details and job requirements for this position.

This position requires applicants to have a minimum of the following:
Master’s degree* and 1 year of related** experience
Bachelor’s Degree* and 2 years of related** experience; OR
Diploma* and 3 years related** experience; OR
Certificate or coursework* and 4 years related** experience; OR
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Post-secondary programs may include: Public Policy, Public Health, Public Administration, Law, Social Sciences (i.e. Political Science, Economics, Sociology, Psychology), Statistics, Business, or a related field.
Certificates and Coursework that may be considered:
Project Management Professional (PMP), IAP2, Prosci Change Management, Behavioural Insights, Service Design, UX, Design Thinking, Research Techniques, Public Policy, Data/Analytics, Communications

**Related experience may be obtained through working in the private, public, or non-profit sector, through volunteerism or through internships such as Co-Op.

**Related experience must include all core experience requirements and at least two (2) of supplemental experience requirements:

Core Experience Requirements (all required):
Experience performing in-depth research and analysis of policy issues, and preparing options and recommendations and
Experience writing a variety of documents and/or content for a broad range of audiences, including senior officials.
Supplemental Experience Requirements (at least one (1) required):
Experience researching and providing advice and recommendations on legislation, program and/or service issues or
Experience managing projects and/or project components or
Experience utilizing traditional policy approaches, instruments, and methodology or
Experience reporting on evaluation and performance indicators or
Experience consulting, communicating and/or engaging with rights holders, partners, and stakeholders.
Preference may be given to applicants:
With experience requirements obtained while working in policy in the public sector.
With experience working with the BC health sector.
With data analysis, data management, and reporting experience using STATA, SAS, R, SPSS, the advanced functions of Excel (Power Pivot), Power BI, or another data analysis and database management tools.
Who identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Metis or Inuit) with the required combination of education and experience.

Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.

A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.

Job Description:
The BC Financial Services Authority (BCFSA) protects British Columbians during their most important financial transactions. We regulate BC ’s financial services market, including credit unions, trust companies, registered pension plans, insurance companies and mortgage brokers.
We uphold public confidence by impartially setting and enforcing standards for real estate professionals. We also ensure that consumers dealing with licensed real estate professionals are protected against wrongful actions. By overseeing the most significant financial transactions in BC we ensure fairness, legality and the prosperity of consumers and the province.
BCFSA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all groups. This includes women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who may contribute to diversity at BCFSA.
We recognize unique styles, perspectives, beliefs, and creativity that support a diverse, respectful, inclusive and collaborative work environment. To achieve this, we stay committed to:
Hiring team members who represent the population we serve
Removing barriers that may prevent equitable employment
Supporting respectful work environments where everyone feels included and able to produce excellent results
BCFSA is proud to be Great Place to Work Certified™ organization based on direct feedback from our team members.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Healthy living and work-life balance
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits plan
Opportunities for personal and professional development
Competitive compensation
A challenging and engaging team environment
Defined benefits pension plan
Flexible work arrangement for eligible positions
A beautiful office location in downtown Vancouver
SUMMARY
This position examines, monitors, and assesses the financial soundness, business strategies and regulatory compliance of financial institutions. Maintains an updated and accurate risk profile for each assigned institution.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Maintains accurate risk profiles, assesses and monitors risks and makes recommendations regarding assigned financial institutions.Prepares summaries of information gathered from monitoring activities, notification letters and reports on the implementation of corrective actions and compliance with supervisory requirements.Participates in onsite reviews of financial institutions to identify and assess inherent risks and assess risk management control functions.Contributes to the production of supervisory strategies and plans for financial institutions.Actively participates in the management of stakeholder relationships including financial institution senior management and Board members.Monitors and evaluates macro-economic, sector and regulatory developments, policies and statistics to determine the impact on provincially regulated financial institutions.Contributes to the team’s development of internal work practices (e.g., policies, procedures and tools).Provides orientation and training to internal and/or external stakeholders within area of responsibility.Contributes to, participates in, and supports organizational business transformation initiatives.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Degree in business, finance, or economics and some related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Related experience includes:
o Financial analysis
o Internal/external audit
o Risk management
o Interpreting and applying legislation, regulations, and/or policy
Preference may be given to applicants with Industry experience in at least one of insurance, credit union, banking, trusts, or related industries.
Knowledge of British Columbia’s supervisory framework governing regulated financial sectors.Knowledge of financial analysis techniques.Knowledge of project management best practices.Knowledge of risk management principles and methods.Ability to exercise judgement, initiative, and discretion.Ability to analyze business plans and financial statements.Ability to write clear and concise documentation, reports, briefing notes, etc.Superior oral and written communication skills.

Overview:

At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.
Our Governance, Risk and Compliance Services (GRCS) team is growing and we are looking for a Senior Consultant – Data Analyst to join our team in Toronto.
Learn more about Risk Consulting here
Learn more about our Toronto office here
What you will do:

As a Senior Consultant, you’ll be learning from some of the best in the industry and growing your personal skillset by:
Work closely with clients and partners in understanding key business issues on digital opportunities
Gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutions
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems to identify areas of risk, opportunities and recommend solutions for our clients. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights
Work in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams to develop a strong experience in analytics, statistics, machine learning, data mining, data management, data governance, reporting, visualization and/or intelligent automation
Work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with both virtual and face-to-face interactions; utilize structured approaches to solving problems, managing risks, and documenting assumptions; communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, and presentations
Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured)
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions
Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues
Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within GRCS, KPMG and the client
What you bring to this role:

You have strong work experience and academic record and excel in an entrepreneurial environment. You’re highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and has the ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.
Strong experience of 3-5 years, working with different kinds of messy, real-world data from a variety of databases
You’re a highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and can achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines
Independent ability to review the data quality and data definitions and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
Strong knowledge and/or experience in the following: SQL, BI tools (like Tableau and PowerBI), Python, R, ETL, Alteryx and RPA tools (like Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere and UIPath)
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tackle ambiguous data processing problems across a diverse range of industries
Experience in data governance, data quality, data processing, and data controls
Client-facing or consulting experience
Experience communicating insights or ideas through presentations and meetings
Certificate or degree in Computing or IT, with a focus on Business Systems Analysis, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis and Reporting, or similar, is an asset
Ability to explain data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems.
Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
Strong relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
Ability to provide crucial consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline drive environment with ambiguity.
Effectively work as part of a project team, and communicate findings of analysis, key implications, and recommendations in written and verbal formats.
Nice to have: Experience in data governance with tools such as Collibra and Informatica
Keys to your success:
KPMG individuals Deliver Impact | Seek Growth | Inspire Trust and understand that a diverse workforce enables us to deepen relationships and strengthen our business.
Providing you with the support you need to be at your best

At Rogers, the entrepreneurial spirit is part of our DNA. Our Rogers Business teams help foster and grow the Canadian economy by supporting businesses of all sizes. From small to large-scale enterprises, our teams help deliver innovative technology, network services, and a suite of solutions to help them succeed. We offer Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network for our customers and are proud leaders in wireless private networking and IoT! We continuously expand and evolve our networks, invest in new technology capabilities, and invest in our people to serve our business customers and their communities.

Come play a key role in driving the future of business innovation in Canada. We are looking for team members with a passion for delivering industry-leading value to customers and supporting businesses in the communities where we live and work.

Are you up for the challenge? If so, consider the following opportunity:
The Network Analyst’s role is to support the stable operation of all End to End’s clients and internal computer network. This includes installing, configuring, maintaining, and optimizing all network hardware, software, and communication links while ensuring minimal network downtime. The person will also diagnose, resolve, and document hardware and software network problems in a timely and accurate fashion.
What you will do:
Incident Management – responsible for technical troubleshooting. In the event of configuration changes required, escalate to Network Professional / Senior Network Professional to invoke internal Change Management Process.Respond to incoming calls, SNMP alarms and e-mails regarding client network issues, client change requests, etc.Open trouble tickets on all incidentsInstall, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot networked peripheral devices and networking hardware and software products.Maintain security solutions, including firewall, VPN and intrusion detection-prevention systems.Maintain all network hardware and equipment, including routers, switches, hubs, etc.Work with vendors and carriers during problem analysis/resolution as required.Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.Take direction from Network Professionals and Senior Network ProfessionalsPerform on-site analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of complex network problems for a variety of clients, and recommend and implement corrective hardware and software solutions, including off-site repair.Recommend, schedule, and perform network improvements, upgrades, and repairs.Support development and implementation of networking projects and new technology installations.Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards in support of network procurement and development efforts. Evaluate and recommend for purchase networking hardware and software products.Maintain up-to-date knowledge of client contracts.Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory.Prepare, maintain, and adhere to procedures for logging, reporting, and statistically monitoring network data.Liaise with, and provide training and support to other Network Analysts on network issues.Prepare and ensure accuracy of documentation, procedures, manuals, and checklists.Aid in development of business continuity and disaster recovery plans, and maintain current knowledge of plan executables. Respond to emergency network outages in accordance with business continuity and disaster recovery plans.Understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.
What you bring:
College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and/or 5 years equivalent work experience.Certifications with Cisco, Juniper, and/or Fortinet (CCNA/JNCIA/FCNSA/NSE4 minimum requirement).Working technical knowledge of network and PC operating systems.Working technical knowledge of current network hardware, protocols, and standards.Ability to operate network component analyzers, scanners, and testers.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Strong written and oral communication skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsLearn, understand and apply new strategies and technologiesMentor/train less experienced co-workersWork both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentCommunicate to and work with Clients and co-workersEffectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment and can adapt to shifting priorities in the daily workload.

Posting Notes: Corporate

Senior Risk Analyst (Remote)
Kora Financial Inc. is looking to hire a full-time Senior Risk Analyst to join our Risk Team. Are you self-motivated and goal-oriented? Are you ready to enjoy where you work? Have you been searching for a company that will value your contributions? If so, please read on!
This position earns a competitive salary of $80,000 - $95,000 CAD based on experience. In addition to health spendings, we provide fantastic perks, including a flexible work-from-home policy, a company-provided MacBook, potential stock options, and an annual $500 learning credit. If this sounds like the right leadership opportunity for you, apply today!
About Kora
Since our inception, our goal at Kora Financial has been to provide college students access to their financial world before they graduate, not years later. Our team strives to build financial products that are fair, simple, and transparent with the goal of revolutionizing the status quo of college students' financial life. The Kora platform empowers students with financial literacy, smart savings, and opportunities to build a credit history.
Our team is tight-knit and collaborative with a strong focus on execution and delivery. We know that we are only as successful as our team is strong. By providing exceptional benefits and company-wide perks, we encourage our employees to be their best selves!
Job Description
Kora is looking to hire a senior risk analyst to support end-to-end development and implementation of credit policy and credit risk analysis in the Consumer Lending space. This includes automated and judgmental decisioning credit policies for new account acquisition approval/decline, line assignment and portfolio risk management. The ideal candidate has at least 3 year in the unsecured personal loan as well as meticulous attention to detail, a collaborative attitude, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Job Responsibilities
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and the position will perform other duties as assigned.
Drive monitoring and analysis of credit risk for consumer loan products, prepare related management reporting packages and provide insights on root causes, emerging credit trends and implications on allowance for Loan Losses.
Lead the regular backtesting and validation of the credit risk model. Perform deep dive on credit policy change to drive credit optimization and risk mitigation strategies, inform corporate strategic decisions, enable better member experience and improve efficiencies.
Partner with key stakeholders in various groups (Risk & Analytics, Compliance, Operations, and Finance) to identify areas of opportunity and spearhead initiatives in order to enable profitable growth while minimizing credit risk exposure and adapting to the changing regulatory environment.
Provide ongoing or ad-hoc risk analytics to support credit or new product expansion.
Collaborate with business line product managers in optimizing marketing campaigns used in acquisitions that align with the credit policies and scoring models.
Identify required data and work with data stewards to understand data source, ensure data quality and retrieve data on a timely basis. Contribute to credit data mart and corporate database designs.
Participate in external and internal audits, and regulatory examinations as needed.
Qualifications
Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered.
Master's Degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience in credit policy or credit risk management in the consumer lending industry. Experience in underwriting is a huge plus.
Strong skills in various data analysis and visualization tools including SQL and Excel. Proficiency in Python is required.
Curiosity, attention to details, strong critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to work effectively in ambiguous situations, ability to multitask.
Self-motivated and strong interpersonal skills in order to actively lead and implement ideas in a cross-functional team environment.

Job_title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Job_Desc:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Marketing Technologies and Analytics (MT&A) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.

The MT&A team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.

The MT&A team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.
Job Description
The successful candidate will be responsible for campaign analytics supporting the growing needs of the Credit Cards team within the broader Marketing Analytics Delivery group.

Your goal as a part of the Marketing Analytics Delivery team is to design and execute campaigns to drive acquisition, customer management, loyalty, and engagement across personal and business banking products. Success in this role will be achieved by:

1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI
2. Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence
3. Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting
4. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting

Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.

Responsibilities
Design/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments
Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
Execute with excellence
Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure
Skill Sets
Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)
Technical and detail oriented
Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SAS
A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications
Team player while able to work independently
Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts
A profit driven mindset
Job Requirements
4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)
Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) an asset
Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements
Knowledge of Python, Azure, Hadoop
Experience designing successful direct marketing experiments
Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline
Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget
Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

We care about our communities, we care about each other, and we care about showing up for those who need us. We value and encourage different perspectives and we have the courage to do the right thing, even when it’s hard.
DESCRIPTION:
Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Strategic Planning & Forecasting, this position is responsible for research, analysis, developing high-level analytical tools and summaries of information pertaining to current macroeconomic and geopolitical trends, government related issues and market fundamentals. Relocation support will be provided to the successful candidate.
WHAT YOU GET TO DO:
Market Research and Analytical Support
Responsible for performing day-to-day functions related to general accounting with minimum assistance. Key activities include:
Conduct Research and Analysis of Macroeconomic & Geopolitical Trends, which includes gathering intelligence to analyze trends in energy transition, Indigenous reconciliation, and other global issues.
Provide general and analytical support to the Corporate Affairs /Government Relations Teams on an ongoing basis. This includes conducting research and analysis of current Government Related issues, preparing briefing papers, summary materials, and analysis of government-related issues for senior leaders across ATCO.
Maintaining a comprehensive understanding of the different factors (such as markets, trends, regulations, government policy proposals and/or changes, government budgets) that impact the corporation.
Research, analyze, monitor, and maintain an understanding of government policy and regulatory issues and government incentive programs in ATCO’s global markets, with a particular focus on Canada.
Monitor policy activities, trends, and issues related to energy and climate policy.
Monitor and research industry peers as well as economic trends and market fundamentals.
Executive support by researching and preparing materials for briefings, presentations, discussions, and panels
Project specific work as required.
Modelling and Analysis
Supporting high priority analytical tasks
Develop analytical tools and economic and financial forecasting models to support strategic business decision-making and advocacy support.
Undertake peer reviews of critical inputs for models and/or analytical tools used by industry. Ensure that the inputs reasonably reflect the drivers.
Support/provide feedback on studies in different parts of the organizational and strategize on assumptions for the business and determine what changes can be made to better serve the company.
Building and maintaining models that support strategic analysis projects.
Effective communication of model results to interested parties at all levels of the organization.
Government Relations Support Backup
Following established procedures and guidelines. Working with the Sr. Analyst of Government Relations, exercise accuracy to support ATCO’s Federal lobbyist registration. Specifically, to the monthly communication reporting requirements for meetings with Designated Public Office Holders (DPOH).
Working with the Sr. Analyst of Government Relations, exercise accuracy to help manage the Government Funding Programs Teams site and provide monthly update reports to senior executives.
Presentation and Communication Support
Proven proficiency in PowerPoint and presentation skills to help create effective slides in a presentation.
Maintain the files in SharePoint site / Team drives and update as required.
Work with teams and leaders to implement formal learning opportunities, develop charts/graphs compelling presentations and other communications material in support of ATCO’s engagement on key issues.
Other Duties
Support for special projects as required by ATCO’s senior leadership and the Office of the Chair
Support processing of invoices/timesheets as required
Manage stakeholder lists and assist with coordinating meetings and sending meeting invites out as required
Represent the Corporate Affairs team by participating and / or leading committees, cross functions project teams and initiatives as required.
WHO YOU ARE:
Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics, or related field is required.
Professional Designation is preferred.
7-10 years of experience minimum in an analytical role with a focus on the energy industry
Operates with a high level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability.
Proven proficiency with applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Ability to deal professionally with all levels of internal and external stakeholders.
Works independently with little direction; handle multiple projects with a range of business interests working in multiple locations globally.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to provide sound and reliable judgment in complex situations.
Knowledge of market databases
Innovative problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail and ability to produce high-quality deliverables
Flexibility and resilience, including ability to adapt to changing/uncertain conditions.
Strong communication skills.
Ability to effectively and concisely tailor complex technical data, policy documents, or legislation to the intended audience.
Acute attention to detail.
WHAT WE OFFER:
A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, and striving for excellence.
Competitive compensation.
Flex benefits.
Tuition assistance program.
Training and mentorship programs.
Charitable donation matching.
We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

We are a diversified global corporation with investments in the essential services of Structures & Logistics, Utilities, Energy Infrastructure, Retail Energy, Transportation and Commercial Real Estate. Learn more about how we build communities, energize industries and deliver customer-focused solutions like no other company in the world at www.atco.com. ATCO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website for more information.

Job Description Senior Analyst, Health System Analytics


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Learn about our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and the work being done to create a more inclusive and welcoming organization by focusing on how we learn, govern and practise.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts


Why is this role important?
We are looking for a highly motivated team player with analytical skills and ability to use the results to tell a compelling story to join the Health System Analytics team. The Senior Analyst will contribute to the full range of activities involved in the analysis and reporting of various health system issues. These activities include idea generation, literature review, environmental scanning, developing analytical plans, participating in project plan development, conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses, quality checks, making data meaningful and findings interesting, creating report outlines, report writing, project tracking, synthesis and presentation of information. In this role, the Senior Analyst will liaise with external stakeholders (including international and pan-Canadian) and data providers on a variety of subjects.


What you'll do
1. Performs basic and advanced qualitative and quantitative analyses using SAS and other analytical tools. This requires the use of analytical techniques to produce outputs from administrative databases and other sources.

2. Provides coordination support to and assists with the identification and completion of a series of analytical products using a broad range of data sources. This will include working with internal and external stakeholders.

3. In close collaboration with other staff, prepares and contributes to literature reviews, and the writing and production of analytical reports and related material as required.


4. Assists in idea generation, drafting analytical plans, project tracking, and quality reviews.

5. Ensures quality of products and activities are aligned with CIHI standards (e.g. quality, privacy, etc.).


6. Develops and maintains knowledge about health system performance indicators and data sources, quantitative analytical techniques and research methods.


7. Participates on project teams as required and assists in the development and maintenance of the project plans, conducting ad hoc analyses as necessary and providing content expertise.

8. Represents the team, branch and the organization internally/externally, including participation on committees, presentations and/or attendance at conferences, preparation of articles for publication and other activities as required.

9. Provides methodological and data quality advice in areas of expertise.

10. Provides direction to junior staff working on selected projects.


What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in epidemiology, health sciences, health policy, health economics, social sciences, statistics or similar field. Graduate degree is an asset.
Three to five years’ experience working in a health care research or policy environment involved in the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products.

Experience using SAS to analyze administrative, clinical and/or survey data sources. Experience with R or Python programming languages is an asset.

Existing knowledge of CIHI data holdings such as, Discharge Abstract Database (DAD), National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS), and the Continuing Care Reporting System (CCRS)is an asset

Experience with the use of health data to support analysis of health system performance.

Knowledge of international health care system indicators is an asset.

Good conceptual knowledge of health and its broad determinants, of the measurement of health status and the Canadian health system.

Project management skills and experience would be an asset.

Strong written communication skills and the ability to write for a variety of audiences. The ability to write clearly, straightforward and in an engaging manner.

Strong verbal and interpersonal communication skills.

Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team with minimal supervision.

Strong organizational skills (demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities).

A passion for and deep interest in health care.

Ability to communicate in both official languages would be an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste principal, Analytique du système de santé


Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
L'ICIS offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation. Renseignexz-vous sur notre strategie sur l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion et les efforts que nous déployons pour créer un environnmenent plus inclusif et accueillant en misant sur nos apprentissages, notre gouvernance et nos pratiques.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste principal possédant un solide esprit d’équipe, une grande motivation et des compétences analytiques lui permettant d’exploiter les résultats pour en tirer des messages forts. L’analyste principal contribue à l’ensemble des activités ayant trait aux analyses et à l’élaboration de rapports sur diverses questions liées aux systèmes de santé. Cela comprend la conception d’idées, l’analyse documentaire, l’analyse contextuelle, l’ébauche de plans analytiques, la rédaction de plans de projet, la réalisation d’analyses quantitatives et qualitatives, l’évaluation de la qualité, le traitement des données de façon à les rendre significatives et intéressantes, la rédaction de sommaires et de rapports, le suivi de projets, ainsi que la synthèse et la présentation de l’information. À ce titre, l’analyste principal assure la liaison avec les intervenants externes (à l’étranger et au Canada) et les fournisseurs de données en ce qui a trait à une variété de sujets.


Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
1. Réaliser des analyses qualitatives et quantitatives de base et approfondies au moyen de SAS et d’autres outils analytiques. Cette tâche nécessite le recours à des techniques analytiques visant à produire des résultats à partir de bases de données administratives et d’autres sources.

2. Prendre part à la coordination ainsi qu’à l’établissement et l’achèvement d’une série de produits d’analyse au moyen de diverses sources de données. Cela comprend la collaboration avec les intervenants internes et externes.

3. En étroite collaboration avec d’autres membres du personnel, préparer des analyses documentaires ou y contribuer, ainsi que rédiger et produire des rapports analytiques et la documentation connexe, au besoin.


4. Prendre part à la conception d’idées, à l’ébauche de plans analytiques, au suivi de projets et aux évaluations de la qualité.

5. S’assurer que la qualité des produits et des activités est conforme aux normes de l’ICIS (p. ex. qualité et respect de la vie privée).


6. Élargir et tenir à jour ses connaissances sur les indicateurs de la performance des systèmes de santé ainsi que les sources de données, les techniques analytiques quantitatives et les méthodes de recherche.


7. Travailler avec les équipes de projet, au besoin, et contribuer à l’élaboration et à la tenue à jour des plans de projet, effectuer des analyses ponctuelles et fournir une expertise touchant le contenu, le cas échéant.

8. Représenter l’équipe, la Division et l’organisme, tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, en participant à des comités, en donnant des présentations, en assistant à des conférences, en préparant des articles ou en menant d’autres activités, au besoin.

9. Donner des conseils relatifs à la méthodologie et à la qualité des données dans ses domaines d’expertise.

10. Orienter le personnel subalterne qui travaille à certains projets.


Que mettriez-vous à profit ?

Baccalauréat en épidémiologie, en sciences de la santé, en politiques de la santé, en économie de la santé, en sciences sociales, en statistique ou dans un domaine connexe. Diplômes d’études supérieures, un atout.
3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine des politiques ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé.
Expérience de l’utilisation de SAS pour analyser des sources de données administratives, cliniques ou d’enquête. Expérience des langages de programmation R ou Python, un atout.
Connaissance préalable des banques de données de l’ICIS, comme la Base de données sur les congés des patients (BDCP), le Système national d’information sur les soins ambulatoires (SNISA) et le Système d’information sur les soins de longue durée (SISLD), un atout.
Expérience de l’utilisation des données sur la santé en appui à l’analyse de la performance des systèmes de santé.
Connaissance des indicateurs des systèmes de santé à l’échelle internationale, un atout.
Bonne connaissance conceptuelle de la santé et de ses déterminants généraux, de la mesure de l’état de santé et des systèmes de santé canadiens.
Aptitudes pour la gestion de projets et expérience connexe, un atout.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication écrite et capacité de rédiger des documents à l’intention de divers publics. Capacité d’écrire de manière claire, directe et engageante.
Entregent et excellentes aptitudes pour la communication verbale.
Aptitudes à travailler au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire avec un minimum de supervision.
Bon sens de l’organisation (aptitudes manifestes à gérer de multiples projets et priorités).
Passion et intérêt manifeste pour les soins de santé.
Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout.


Declaration
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.
L’utilisation dans le présent document de la forme masculine ou féminine, selon le contexte, a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.


Équité en emploi
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

The Post Trade risk management team’s mandate is to ensure that all required procedures, models, systems, reporting and governance are in place so that CDS and CDCC financial risks are managed according to TMX risk appetite and policy.

TMX Post Trade’s Risk Management Team utilizes a matrix management structure to conduct first and second line of defense risk management functions for both CDS and CDCC. The risk exposure types managed by the Post Trade Risk Team include credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk, model risk and operational risk. To carry out its mandate, the Risk Team employs sophisticated financial risk models, validation frameworks, risk measurement and reporting systems. The Risk Team collaborates with many internal and external stakeholders including CDS Participants and CDCC Clearing Members, our regulators and our TMX Group partners.

Since CDS and CDCC were designated as systemically important by the Bank of Canada in 2012, TMX Post Trade’s role is to ensure the integrity and stability of the markets that it supports. It further takes the necessary actions to help ensure that the Canadian financial markets meet the G20 commitments.

Reporting to the Manager – Risk Management, the Senior Analyst, Risk Oversight is a key contributor to CDS and CDCC risk oversight activities including recovery planning, risk reporting and default management activities.

More specifically, the incumbent helps improve TMX Post Trade’s risk measurement, management, and governance practices to ensure we maintain high risk management standards in compliance with CPSS-IOSCO Principles for Financial Market Infrastructure (PFMI’s). The Senior Analyst also contributes actively to the development, oversight, and usage of TMX Post Trade groups’ market, credit and liquidity risk management models & tools including providing effective challenge to the “Risk Projects Team” activities.

Key Accountabilities:
Actively participate in the development and oversight processes for financial risk management models, systems and reports including providing an effective challenge to “Risk Projects Team” activities.

Collaborate in the production of risk management measures and reports (e.g. backtesting, stress testing, sensitivity analysis).

Provide expert support in risk measurement, qualitative and quantitative analysis related to equity, fixed income and derivatives products.

Participate in the onboarding and ongoing assessment of CDS and CDCC participants including annual due diligence and quarterly creditworthiness assessment.

Document financial risk monitoring and default management processes, and make recommendations to streamline current processes and improve efficiency.

Support and enhance TMX Post Trade default management preparedness including automation of default and recovery tools and execution of annual industry-wide default simulation exercises.

Collaborate with IT development teams (internal, external) to modernize CDS’ risk management infrastructure including Default Management capabilities enhancement.

Collaborate with legal teams for filings related to new rules, rule amendments, and regulatory guidance.

Skills and Experience :
Master’s degree in a finance discipline such as Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent

Minimum 3 years of experience in the financial industry with a focus on market/financial risk management in a quantitative role (e.g. market, liquidity, or credit risk measurement and management).

Highly motivated self-starter who is flexible and thrives on working collaboratively in a goal-oriented, high-performance team environment.

Strong technology and information system skills, e.g. Matlab, SQL, VBA, R.

CFA, FRM, or work towards them are not mandatory but are considered an asset.

Excellent quantitative and data analysis skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet tight timelines without compromising the integrity of information.

Sound knowledge of financial risk management concepts and techniques, such as Value-at-Risk.

Good communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to explain, summarize, and synthesize abstract financial concepts.

Self-confidence, positive attitude, pragmatism.

Capability to develop strong relationships with the Risk Management team and other business units.

Ability to apply academic knowledge to business situations.

TMX is committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide accommodations for applicants and employees who require it.

Job_title: Senior Business Insights Analyst, Canadian Performance Management
Job_Desc:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about strategy. TD's strategy and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, Not at Risk, Not at Fraud strategy, anyway.

The Fraud Risk Management & Global Security and Investigations (FRM & GSI) is an enterprise-level body that strives to protect TD Bank Group customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, FRM & GSI develops and evolves enterprise policies, advanced analytics capabilities and operational processes to improve governance, oversight, and collaboration between fraud management and other control functions within the Bank.

The Canadian Fraud Management (CFM) team operates within FRM & GSI in a fast-paced environment requiring both strategic and tactical responses to changing fraud patterns and provides a unique opportunity to apply critical thinking and leadership skills in an innovation centric environment.
Job Description
About this Role
This role will be responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring strategies to manage evolving fraud trends, taking into consideration TD's risk appetite and customer and operational experience. The Strategist should display a deep fraud and process expertise, and to leverage that knowledge to:

anticipate and explain potential fraud risks associated with strategic initiatives across TDhelp design policy, process or strategic changes to enable the bank to safely deliver it's strategic roadmapprovide deep fraud and process expertise into solving larger, Fraud-driven strategic initiativesidentify emerging fraud trends and develop defenses against emerging and in-market fraud trendsunderstand and actively managing the operational impacts of our fraud defense strategiesThink horizontally to build and implement solutions that provide value to our Fraud Strategy teams and partners
The successful candidate will work collaboratively with a diverse team of operational agents, Fraud solution developers, data scientists, business insights analysts and subject matter experts and applies fraud business expertise leveraging advanced tools and detection systems to manage risk appropriately. The incumbent will be accountable for loss and customer experience targets.

Accountabilities:
Fraud Management
Accountable for fraud loss targets and the customer experienceReviews daily fraud attacks to create segmentation and develop/implement fraud strategies while balancing the impact to the operational teams and customer experienceStrategizes on adjustments to shifting network rules, liability requirements or other exogenous factorsOwns the strategy design and configuration in all fraud prevention platforms (e.g. Falcon, TSYS, FIS, SQN, PRM, Citadel, DPS, VCas, Avant, Experian, Transunion), in alignment with the Change Management protocolsSupports case valuation and prioritization to optimize fraud managementAre a subject matter expert on the end-to-end operational process, transaction liability and regulatory requirementsProvide ad-hoc analysis to support decision-making at the executive levelDesign champion / challenger strategies that lead to ongoing learning and improvementExpected to leverage that subject matter expertise to independently investigate new, high-risk exposures under very tight timelinesProduce timely diagnostics to identify system, strategy and operational issuesParticipates in defect analysis to identify and remediate coverage gapsProvides horizontal support to all strategy teams for advanced technical builds and consultation for continuous improvementIdentify, track, and provide solutions to ongoing fraud vectors and cross-portfolio threatsThink forward and provide early gap mitigation to emerging threat vectors globally
Partner Support
Works with business partners to understand new intent, and to identify the incremental fraud risks associated with that intentCollaborates with business partners to develop solutions that minimize fraud risk while enabling business partners to achieve bank strategic prioritiesOccasionally provides IT release support to ensure projects reliably deliver on fraud requirementsSupport the continuous improvement agenda for our operational partnersMaintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders such as Fraud Operations, Internal Business Partners, Vendor Managers etc.Act as a subject matter expert and represents the team or bank at project meetings or industry forums

ABOUT VAYNERMEDIA

VaynerMedia is a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, APAC and LATAM. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.

In A Nutshell:

Our media buying teams ensure the execution of media plans are running smoothly and line up with client goals and expectations. As a Senior Media Analyst you'll be responsible for placing campaigns across various digital platforms, developing media buying strategies, and forecasting media spend to deliver against campaign goals.


What You'd Do:

Constantly work to improve campaign performance, insights collection and takeaways, and generally strive to "over-deliver" to clients.
Bid/buy and place campaigns within various digital platforms managing the ongoing real-time optimization of live media to ensure client goals are met and/or exceeded.
Collaborate with media planners on upcoming campaigns determining best platforms, target audience, and creative strategies to implement to develop media plans.
Monitor campaigns for performance ensuring campaigns are pacing accordingly, managing spend, troubleshooting campaigns, creating insights about performance, making updates accordingly and flagging potential issues to management.
Create and occasionally present client-facing campaign reporting: pacing reports, campaign build, ad-hoc analysis, and high-touch optimizations to ensure relevant metrics and insights are shown and make recommendations by condensing or strengthening key insights from campaign reports to optimize performance.
Manage platform relationships regularly via: Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Google, etc.
Oversee Media Analysts bandwidth assisting in the training and development of new and existing Media Analysts on the team.


What You've Got:

1 Year experience as a Media Buyer within an agency, entrepreneurial street cred and/or BA/BS degree (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Finance)
Advanced skills in Excel including pivot tables, V-Look Ups, and macros
Experience across buying/biddable platforms in any of the following:
Social: Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest, LinkedIn, TikTok
Amazon (AMS, Amazon DSP, AMG)
Programmatic Display/Video (DV360, The Trade Desk, AppNexus, etc.)

Any Additional Experience in the following a plus:

Experience working with analytics, attribution and measurement systems. Including but not limited to:
Google Analytics
MOAT/IAS/Double Verify
Nielsen/Millward Brown/Oracle Measurement
Experience working with attribution partners
MTA: VIQ, Neustera
Foot Traffic: Placed, 9th Decimal, PlaceIQ,
Call Attribution: Dialogtech
You live for today's digital & mobile consumer, driven,and hungry to succeed always looking to learn more.
You want to have an impact and is passionate about the work you do.
You are always looking to adopt new techniques and technologies that are relevant for clients' media strategies.
You thrive in a dynamic, fast paced, collaborative, high-energy environment where you're continuously solving problems creatively and analytically.

Why work for Lafarge?:
As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.
Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

Overview:

The Health & Safety Analyst performs essential functions for continuously improving the country’s health and safety program by performing statistical analysis while overseeing, maintaining and improving health and safety programs and systems.
Responsibilities:
Collects and analyzes data used for compiling company safety statistics and trends.
Maintains reports as required for internal reporting.
Provide technical support in the development and maintenance of all H&S program software and databases.
Assists in preparing required reports and presentations on injuries and illnesses and review safe work procedures, policies, and training courses.
Oversees reporting within the internal health and safety reporting system (SAI) by validating entries by others, data entry of information from other systems (SAP), and following up to ensure ontime activity completion.
Provides technical support for users of our internal health and safety reporting system including troubleshooting errors, escalation of issues, and rollout of new requirements.
Organizes and maintains the digital filing system for Health and Safety documents including version control, publishing, formatting and classification of documents.
Creates requisitions and ensures timely review and processing of invoices within SAP.
Creates country health and safety communications including daily incident summaries.
Works closely with the Health and Safety team on new initiatives and supports other health and safety systems as required.
Qualifications:

Education & Work Experience
2+ years experience in an analyst position
Post secondary degree in mathematics, statistics, business, economics, health and safety, is an asset
Knowledge & Skills
Working knowledge of Google Workspace (Mail / Sheets / Documents / Shared Drive management / LumApps intranet / Google Data Studio)
Advanced knowledge in either Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel including creation of formulas and queries
Experience with SAP or comparable enterprise resource planning system
Ability to prioritize, summarize and visualize data analysis for senior management
Self-motivated, strong work ethic, and ability to take initiative
Able to work independently and effectively in a fast paced environment
Attention to detail, critical thinking and recognizing patterns
As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.
LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.
Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.
Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.
We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

250 Yonge Street Toronto Ontario,M5B 2L7

If you’re looking for your next dream job, consider this one in BMO’s ERPM Risk group where every colleague helps protect and grow the bank by providing independent review and oversight of enterprise-wide risks, working together to maintain a risk management framework and fostering a strong risk culture. #ERPMDreamJobs
General Accountabilities
Supports the execution of accurate and efficient reporting solutions for risk, regulatory and management information to internal and external stakeholders including regulatory bodies.
Supports an efficient and effective risk management function which uses common information sources and practices, reduces ongoing costs, increases service level performance and minimizes risk.
Daily operations and system enhancements; creates and participates in the development of testing requirements and validation of implementation of capital requirements for Counterparty Credit Risk (CCR) Capital. Identifies opportunities and leads the enhancement of capital methodologies for quantifying CCR capital across all trading products so that the accuracy and reliability of capital to enhance consequent business decisions reliant upon this data.
Specific Accountabilities
Participate in the development of business requirements for Technology Development and/or vendors for system enhancements, including specification of user acceptance test requirements. Perform user acceptance testing to ensure business and analytic requirements are correctly implemented.
Participate in the implementation process to ensure proper and timely implementation of system enhancements.
Consult with stakeholders to understand the line of business and/or risk objectives, translate business requirements into development tasks, and ensure alignment of priorities.
Identify issues and propose and implementing solutions.
Ensure risk platforms used for risk capture are current and internally consistent.
Assist in the documentation of procedures, control processes, and policies relevant to internal controls.
Engage with end-user groups to provide support as needed
Skill/Attributes
1 to 3 years of related work experience, preferably in a financial institution;
Bachelors/Master’s degree in a technical field, i.e. Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics
Good organization skills including planning, scheduling, coordinating resources, managing priorities and meeting deadlines
Strong analytic and troubleshooting skills with a solution oriented attitude
Strong proficiency with Excel, VBA, SQL, Database Concepts, SDLC
Good oral and written communication skills;
Good relationship management skills.
Broad understanding and experience with risk management methodologies, preferably in Counterparty Credit Risk

Market Risk

Technology & Operations
Credit and portfolio management
Account Management
Capital Markets Trading Lines of Business
Vendors
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. We are a group of Business Analysts, Data Analysts, and Engineers who work with multiple teams to provide insight about our online services that enhance the game experience. We support a multi-billion-dollar video game ecosystem and non-development departments within EA – our portfolio is wide. Our environments are challenged by marketing promotions, game launches, and security threats. We are passionate about automation. You will report to the Director of Business Operations, inside the Production, Infrastructure, and Engineering team.
Your Skills
The systems we support are diverse, produced by dozens of teams from around the world. You will have a diverse skill set and always be eager to expand it. More importantly, you can apply your conceptual understanding to new technologies. The below is a representative but non-exhaustive list of the skills we are looking for in you.
Partner, liaise, and translate technical requirements to spend with teams across the organization
Leverage data visualization software packages, e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau to empower the organization with interactive dashboards to perform on-demand analysis
Build executive reports and infographics for senior management, to review financial performance across multiple business lines and make data-driven decisions
Perform advanced SQL querying, data mining, and data cleansing
Collaborate effectively with Data Engineering to develop production ready data models and purpose-built data pipelines
Provide strategic insights to partners and leadership, optimizing our products
Experience working with Infrastructure cost and usage, including Cloud Financial Management (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with SQL: including experience querying complex data sets
Advanced knowledge of experiment design
Advanced visualization and presentation skills
Strong grasp of statistics and experience conducting rigorous data analyses
Familiarity with Python
A B.A./B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or Engineering Sciences
5+ years of experience in related fields

Electronic Arts is the leading interactive entertainment company, powered by innovative technology. We create incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need creative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

Description
Help business leaders make strategic decisions.

Join our team

Today, TELUS customers enjoy the best deals and communications. Behind the scenes, however, hundreds of different systems are at play determining how customers can enjoy competitive rates and awesome customer service. The Home Solutions Market Intelligence team builds solutions for our stakeholders by understanding and turning data into insights to help drive the success of TELUS. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Our team is known within TELUS as a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is a great place to learn and grow. We have a culture of curiosity, collaboration, recognition, and high performance.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You are a team player with a proven ability to translate technical considerations into business implications as well as to synthesize data into actionable insights. You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a fundamental understanding of data manipulation techniques and their value to strategy. You have experience with agile ways of working and a bias for action to break down barriers to get results fast with a test-and-learn mindset.

As a Business Consultant, you will be accountable for accelerating the capabilities of our Home Solutions Marketing Intelligence team. You will accomplish your objectives by working closely with Senior Business Analysts to creatively build reporting and analytical capabilities. The stakeholders you support will benefit from reporting and insights with a focus on reliability, accuracy, and timeliness to drive the right decisions for TELUS.

Here’s how

By providing timely and actionable reporting and insights to support decision-making across the organization
By implementing best in class, reporting insights (Dashboards) to drive operational efficiencies and improved decision-making
By driving the capabilities of the team to translate business questions and requirements into actionable insights and stories, not just data and reports
By working in conjunction with Sales, Finance, Marketing, and others to design innovative data visualizations and implement self-serve reporting tools such as Tableau and Domo, to deliver enhanced capabilities to end-users
By enabling business users and teams to leverage existing data infrastructure through customer reports and ad-hoc queries
By collaborating with our stakeholders, Business Intelligence team, and Business Transformation Operations (BTO) teams to provide requirements as part of our reporting capabilities roadmap
By providing expert technical guidance to analysts and other team members

Qualifications
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience with Oracle (SQL) and experience working with relational databases, query authoring as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
Expert knowledge and understanding of global best practices in business intelligence, performance reporting, and supporting tools such as Tableau, DOMO, SAS, Oracle, GCP, etc
Strong business acumen and financial / business case practices
Ability to work effectively and diplomatically with management and cross-functional teams
Strong presentation, analytical, and data interpretation skills
Expert ability to break down and decompose complex data sets and ambiguous problems to tell meaningful business stories
A university degree or college degree in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related experience
5+ years of experience working with data, analytics, and, business performance reporting

Great-to-haves

Knowledge of telecommunications business models, measures, and metrics
Hands-on experience using Python
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) -> Big Query/Python
Experience with SAS -> Macros
Tableau/DOMO certifications

Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. INSTRUCTIONS TO FOLLOW

You must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience qualifications, both essential and assets, by responding to the screening questions in the online application. Please note that it is not sufficient to only state that the requirement is met or to provide a listing of current responsibilities; rather, you must provide concrete examples that illustrate how you meet the requirement. Lack of details may result in your application being rejected as the Assessment Board will have insufficient information to determine whether or not you meet the qualifications. To have a better idea on how to answer the screening questions, we encourage you to watch this video developed by the Treasury Board Secretariat: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0GW7P3g9hhI

Written communication will be assessed throughout the process.

Exams will be sent to those that have been screened in between October 14 - October 24, 2022
Work environment
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is the federal government agency responsible for administering sentences of a term of two years or more, as imposed by the courts. CSC is responsible for managing institutions of various security levels and supervising offenders under conditional release in the community.

CSC is embracing an efficient and flexible hybrid model, where work functions permit. We are currently transitioning to a hybrid model with an option for a mix of telework and in-person work at the office.
Intent of the process
Although the immediate intent of this Job Opportunity Advertisement is to staff indeterminately, applicants should be aware that a pool of qualified candidates may be established and may be used to staff similar positions at this group and level. In addition, this process may be used for various tenures (acting appointments, assignment, deployment, indeterminate, specified period, secondment), various locations, various security requirements and conditions of employment. As a result of the potential and possible use of the selection process and subsequent pool by hiring managers, we encourage all employees seeking this type of opportunity to apply.
Positions to be filled: 6
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
Education

Degree from a recognized university with an acceptable specialization* in economics, sociology, or statistics.

All applicants must hold a degree. An acceptable specialization must include at a minimum 1 course in research methods, statistics or policy analysis. These courses do not need to be part of a degree program in economics, sociology, or statistics. Equivalent courses may be taken in other programs for example, but not limited to: epidemiology, data science/data analytics, demography/population studies, health sciences, or a health profession.
Degree equivalency
Experience

Significant* experience analyzing policy, population needs, and/or system performance.Experience working in an area related to health care.

significant is defined as depth and breadth of experience normally associated with the performance of those duties on a regular basis for a period of approximately 3 years. A shorter duration may be considered based on demonstrated complexity and diversity of work handled, scope of work, and/or level of direct responsibility for a wide variety of complex files and/or projects.
Competencies

Create vision and strategyUphold integrity and respectCollaborate with partners and stakeholdersAchieve resultsMobilize peoplePromote innovation and guide change
Ability

Ability to conduct complex** data or policy analysis.
Ability to develop recommendations and provide advice to senior managementAbility to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing
** complex refers to multi-faceted issues/data that are interconnected, involve multiple stakeholders, are highly sensitive, and/or difficult to understand

Information on employment equity
Depending on the number of applicants, CSC's needs and HR plans, volume management strategies such as, but not limited to, top-down approach, cut-off scores, random selection and/or assessment may be used for the purpose of managing applications/candidates.
