The Post Trade risk management team’s mandate is to ensure that all required procedures, models, systems, reporting and governance are in place so that CDS and CDCC financial risks are managed according to TMX risk appetite and policy.

TMX Post Trade’s Risk Management Team utilizes a matrix management structure to conduct first and second line of defense risk management functions for both CDS and CDCC. The risk exposure types managed by the Post Trade Risk Team include credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk, model risk and operational risk. To carry out its mandate, the Risk Team employs sophisticated financial risk models, validation frameworks, risk measurement and reporting systems. The Risk Team collaborates with many internal and external stakeholders including CDS Participants and CDCC Clearing Members, our regulators and our TMX Group partners.

Since CDS and CDCC were designated as systemically important by the Bank of Canada in 2012, TMX Post Trade’s role is to ensure the integrity and stability of the markets that it supports. It further takes the necessary actions to help ensure that the Canadian financial markets meet the G20 commitments.
Reporting to the Manager – Risk Management, the Senior Analyst, Risk Oversight is a key contributor to CDS and CDCC risk oversight activities including recovery planning, risk reporting and default management activities.
More specifically, the incumbent helps improve TMX Post Trade’s risk measurement, management, and governance practices to ensure we maintain high risk management standards in compliance with CPSS-IOSCO Principles for Financial Market Infrastructure (PFMI’s). The Senior Analyst also contributes actively to the development, oversight, and usage of TMX Post Trade groups’ market, credit and liquidity risk management models & tools including providing effective challenge to the “Risk Projects Team” activities.
Key Accountabilities:
Actively participate in the development and oversight processes for financial risk management models, systems and reports including providing an effective challenge to “Risk Projects Team” activities.
Collaborate in the production of risk management measures and reports (e.g. backtesting, stress testing, sensitivity analysis).
Provide expert support in risk measurement, qualitative and quantitative analysis related to equity, fixed income and derivatives products.
Participate in the onboarding and ongoing assessment of CDS and CDCC participants including annual due diligence and quarterly creditworthiness assessment.
Document financial risk monitoring and default management processes, and make recommendations to streamline current processes and improve efficiency.
Support and improve TMX Post Trade default management preparedness including automation of default and recovery tools and execution of annual industry-wide default simulation exercises.
Collaborate with IT development teams (internal, external) to modernize CDS’ risk management infrastructure including Default Management capabilities enhancement.
Collaborate with legal teams for filings related to new rules, rule amendments, and regulatory guidance.
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in a finance discipline such as Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent
Minimum 3 years of experience in the financial industry with a focus on market/financial risk management in a quantitative role (e.g. market, liquidity, or credit risk measurement and management).
Highly motivated self-starter who is flexible and thrives on working collaboratively in a goal-oriented, high-performance team environment.
Strong technology and information system skills, e.g. Matlab, SQL, VBA, R.
CFA, FRM, or work towards them are not mandatory but are considered an asset.
Excellent quantitative and data analysis skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet tight timelines without compromising the integrity of information.
Sound knowledge of financial risk management concepts and techniques, such as Value-at-Risk.
Good communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to explain, summarize, and synthesize abstract financial concepts.
Self-confidence, positive attitude, pragmatism.
Capability to develop positive relationships with the Risk Management team and other business units.
Ability to apply academic knowledge to business situations.
TMX is committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide accommodations for applicants and employees who require it.

Your Opportunity:
If you are passionate about working with data to providing data-informed evidence and guidance to scientists and stakeholders to drive innovations in cancer and chronic disease prevention - this role is for you! The senior analyst will provide advanced data management, analytical and reporting functions, and dashboard development support in a key role in the CPSI Surveillance Innovation stream. Taking guidance from the Senior Scientists, Scientists and Data Integration Lead, the Sr. Analyst generates, prepares and organizes health information to aid in the completion of routine and ad hoc requests related to cancer and chronic disease prevention. The senior analyst uses multiple and diverse datasets including population, socio-demographics, and health care utilization data to help the team describe and monitor the health of populations across the province. The senior analyst is highly proficient in organizing and manipulating data and creating new datasets from existing data sources for analysis and reporting using a variety of sophisticated tools and approaches including accessing large datasets on Oracle data servers, statistical software coding in SAS, and preferably also has experience in use of GIS and interactive web reporting tools such as Tableau. The Senior Analyst collects, maintains, compiles, synthesizes, interprets, analyzes and reports primary and secondary data and supports the development and maintenance of datasets. The Senior Analyst also applies research principles, frameworks, concepts, methods and processes to address surveillance and health status assessment as well as population and public health issues to inform decision-making. This position establishes and maintains positive relationships with other analysts within Provincial Population and Public Health and AHS Data and Analytics.
Description:
Development of Information Related to Cancer and Chronic Disease Prevention. Works with CPSI Surveillance stream scientist and lead and members of other CPSI innovation streams to define data needs, establish methodologies to analyze data and report results in a manner that is suited to a variety of key audiences, including public health professionals and non-expert audiences. Analysis includes working with both descriptive statistics and more advanced statistical analyses such as inferential and predictive statistics. Ensures integrity and rigor of datasets including data retrieval, ethical data management, analysis, and report preparation. Prepares and presents findings, providing consultation and advice to stakeholders to ensure their understanding and approval. Stakeholders Relationship Management. Meets with stakeholders (including CPSI team members) to confirm query and refine/clarify as needed and determine the methodology and reporting design that is best able to meet the request. Advises and negotiates with stakeholders when data is not available or is inconsistent with the request to determine a feasible alternative. Indicators and Measures Development. Provides advice to stakeholders on development of indicators and measures and analytical methods relevant to their needs. Process Improvement and Planning. Researches and applies best practice in data management and analytics. Contributes to the conduct of literature reviews in public health or methodological areas of relevance to inform new approaches for analysis. Participates in team operational planning. Provides advice and recommendations to the Team lead on process, capacity and quality improvements in support of CPSI and PHEI goals. Participates as needed in the prioritization of requests to balance competing demands.
Classification: Senior Analyst
Union: Exempt
Unit and Program: Cancer Prevention and Screening Innovation, Provincial Population and Public Health
Primary Location: Holy Cross Site Phase II
Location Details: Eligible to work remotely
Temporary Employee Class: Temp F/T Benefits
FTE: 1.00
Posting End Date: 07-OCT-2022
Date Available: 17-OCT-2022
Temporary End Date: 29-MAR-2024
Hours per Shift: 7.75
Length of Shift in weeks: 2
Shifts per cycle: 10
Shift Pattern: Days
Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
Minimum Salary: $28.20
Maximum Salary: $48.45
Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable
Required Qualifications:
Masters Degree in a quantitative health-related field (e.g., Public Health; Epidemiology; Health Economics) and a minimum of three years experience in a population health-related field.
Additional Required Qualifications:
Strong computer skills and proficiency with word processing, spreadsheets and relational databases. Proficiency in SAS statistical analytical software is required.
Preferred Qualifications:
Preferred candidates have experience/proficiency with one or more of: R, Tableau, SQL, ArcGIS and interactive web reporting tools (i.e. dashboards or atlases). Strong interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Understanding of research methods and operations. A demonstrated clear pattern of professional and personal development.

Job_title: Senior AnalystSenior Analyst - Group Treasury Product Control
Job_Desc:
Requisition ID: 159277

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
The Senior Analyst – Group Treasury Product Control is a member of Product Control team, responsible for providing P&L and Accounting support for a number of books and / or strategies for Group Treasury.
The Product Control Department is the Profit & Loss control group providing support to Scotiabank Global Banking & Markets. Product Control is responsible for P&L reporting, P&L and risk attribution and analysis, valuation & independent price verification (IPV), reconciliation of reported P&L to Front Office estimates and to the general ledger, the substantiation of balance sheet accounts, issue identification and resolution, and the maintenance of business performance and control MIS.
As the Product Control function is still relatively new to Scotiabank, the Senior Analyst should provide a proactive and dynamic approach.
The position is based in Toronto.
Key Accountabilities:
The Incumbent will play a key role in the maintenance of an efficient and risk effective control environment for Group Treasury Product Control. The incumbent will be responsible for:
Produce and report daily P&L. Confirmation of P&L integrity/ validation through risk based attribution. Reconciliation of daily P&L to FO expectations with corresponding P&L explanatory to ensure P&L Sign-off by the Front Office. Coordination and resolution of P&L breaks between FO and Product Control through collaborative dialogue.
Ensuring daily reported P&L is reconciled to the Bank’s General Ledger and associated source system sub ledgers. Adoption of a proactive approach to ensure breaks are escalated and resolved on a timely basis as required by established work-flows. Ensuring balance sheet accounts are substantiated and that all accounting issues are resolved on a timely basis. Orchestrate and complete the Month-End Close Sign-off and MIS Package.
Strong understanding of risk analytics to develop and implement infrastructure processes aimed at effectively capturing and reflecting risk profile of business.
Production, Review and Analysis of IPV, Reserves and Fair Value Adjustments as may be required in agreement with Risk Management and as required by Bank Guidelines. The coordination and timely resolution of Issues with the Front and Back Offices, and Risk Management.
Supporting other financial reporting needs as may be required.
The incumbent will support the Manager and Senior Manager in establishing support for new products/business in a controlled manner and actively engage in requests for support, analysis and information from various constituents including the Front Office, Risk Management, Operations, Finance, Audit and Regulators.
Experience / Education:
The incumbent must have:
Experience with P&L construction and risk attribution, capital markets accounting, balance sheet substantiation and IPV process.
A minimum of 2 – 4 years in relevant hands-on experience in Product Control (alternatively, Middle Office, Product Control, Finance or Operations) supporting a Capital Markets environment.
Expert knowledge of P&L and Balance Sheet control backed by a Business Degree focused on Finance and Accounting and/ or Risk Analytics. A professional accounting designation is preferred. A CFA or FRM will also be an asset.
A solid understanding of Bank accounting policies, trading policies, market practice, regulatory requirements and the inherent risks associated with all of capital market products.
Strong problem solving skills and proficiency with Excel.
Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with a demanding Front-Office client base.
The incumbent must have leadership ability, be self-motivated and be able to operate in a back-up capacity to the Manager
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Financial Mathematics, Financial Engineering in combination with business / accounting is preferred.
A professional accounting designation is preferred. A CFA or FRM will also be an asset.
This is a temporary full time role for 9 months.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

This posting is for a term position, working 75 hours bi-weekly until September 6, 2023. The eligibility list for this position may also be used to fill permanent or anticipatory permanent positions over the next 12 months.

Yukon government’s vision is an engaged and diverse public service that embraces innovation to deliver positive outcomes for Yukoners.

Who we are…
Yukon Bureau of Statistics (YBS) is a branch within the Yukon Government in the Department of Finance. The Bureau helps governments, businesses and residents of Yukon make informed decisions with the provision of timely and reliable statistical information. YBS collects, analyses and publishes statistical information, and works on statistical research projects and data modelling.

YBS collaborates with and assists YG departments in providing professional expertise and support in data collection, analysis, and statistical research. The Bureau also collaborates with Statistics Canada, other federal departments, and provincial/territorial statistical agencies on matters of mutual interest, and exchanges ideas and information with them.

What we are looking for…
We are looking for a Programmer and Research Analyst who is a results-oriented and hands-on professional; someone who is enthusiastic and driven to work in a fast-paced environment. Our ideal candidate is skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Under the supervision of the Senior Data Scientist, the incumbent will be responsible for, among others, programming survey systems, providing technical support for data collection, managing survey databases, conducting data analysis, and writing reports.

The successful candidate will:
Program survey systems (e.g., Voxco multimode, Checkbox, etc.) to build user-friendly survey applications for data collection, and maintain survey systems;
Develop contents and build campaign webpages for survey invitations on Yukon.ca using content operations platform and content management system;
Provide seamless technical support to the Operations Unit of the Bureau during the data collection phase of survey programs and projects;
Extract data from survey applications or administrative databases, validate data to identify and resolve any inconsistency, and prepare data files for analysis;
Conduct statistical analysis of data using statistical analysis software (such as SAS, R, Excel, etc.), and develop reports for a wide variety of clients;
Develop and implement procedures for data validation, and develop programs for data analysis using software for statistical analysis (e.g., SAS, R, etc.);
Interpret results of data analysis and produce reports for evidence-based decision-making by a wide variety of users; and
Provide technical and methodological assistance to program/project team members of YBS in validation and analyses of data.

Please see the attached job description for an outline of the duties and responsibilities, and other information relating to the position.
What we can offer…
Yukon government cares about their employees and strives to offer a variety of learning and developmental opportunities including in-house training. Funding may also be available to support further education. Flexible work and leave options may be available allowing you to balance your personal and professional needs.
We also have a comprehensive and generous benefits plan that provides healthcare and wellbeing services to you and your family.
Learn more about what we offer.
Discover why the Yukon government has been recognized as a Top 100 Employer in Canada since 2014.
Hear from some of our employees about what its like to live and work in the Yukon.

Important application requirements:
Please submit your resume clearly demonstrating how you meet each of the following qualifications. Emphasize how your work experiences and related duties align with the essential and asset qualifications listed below. Note that selection for further consideration is based solely on the information you provide in your resume.

Include the month and year you started and ended a job when you list your work experience. This allows us to accurately calculate the length of time you were in the position.
For more information on how to prepare and submit your resume visit this resource page on Yukon.ca.

Essential Qualifications
Post-secondary education in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field;
Experience in programming browser-based survey software for data collection;
Experience in programming statistical software, preferably SAS; and
Experience in data analysis and report writing.
Candidates with an equivalent combination of relevant academic qualifications, professional training and work experience may also be considered.

Desired Knowledge, Skills and Suitability
To best support the achievement of key strategic and business objectives, candidates may be assessed on:
Knowledge of survey questionnaire development and programming
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks, and adapt to changing priorities
Proficiency in SAS/R and/or advanced functionalities of Microsoft Excel
Oral and written communication skills

Additional Information
Condition Of Employment: Security Clearance
Contact Details:
If you have any questions about this position, please contact:
Xiaoyu Yu, Senior Data Scientist, Yukon Bureau of Statistics at Xiaoyu.Yu@yukon.ca; or
Bishnu Saha, Director, Yukon Bureau of Statistics at Bishnu.Saha@yukon.ca

If you have questions about our recruitment process, please contact: Danielle Marrion, Human Resource Consultant at Danielle.Marrion@yukon.ca

12 months

Job_title: Senior Analyst, Marketing and Customer Experience
Job_Desc:
WHO WE ARE

HomeEquity Bank is a Schedule 1 Canadian chartered bank and the leading national provider of reverse mortgages, with a growing portfolio. As the only bank solely dedicated to serving homeowners 55 and up, we’re passionate about helping Canadian homeowners live retirement on their terms. We live that commitment every day, with a range of reverse mortgage solutions that include our flagship CHIP Reverse Mortgage™ product.

Our Values, Our Passion
At HomeEquity Bank, our values drive and inspire our actions with our customers, our partners and each other.

We Are Customer-Focused, Passionate Advocates.

We Have the Courage to Act and Do the Right Thing.

We Are One Team, with One Vision.

We Think Long-Term, We Are Ever-Evolving.

We Strive to Be Exceptional and Inspire Greatness.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior Analyst will work closely with Marketing and Customer Experience leaders to help support the group’s many initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for working collaboratively with leaders to identify opportunities and put forward supporting recommendations. The role will also be accountable for the development of executive content, supporting the VPs, SVP, and EVP.

This role requires a critical and strategic thinker with excellent data analysis skills. The development and tracking of Key performance indicators will be critical to enhance the understanding of the business and to improve decision-making. The successful candidate must be able to exercise discretion, good judgment and take initiative. Working with and presenting to members of the Management Team, the incumbent must act as a key resource in providing data and analytical support to achieve our objectives.

MAJOR ELEMENTS OF THE ROLE:

Support Marketing and Customer Experience group in planning, analyzing, and reporting on ongoing performance, KPIs, projects and initiatives
Leverage data and analytics to gain a deep understanding of business, uncover trends, and help drive critical business decision-making based on various data modeling and 1st party data
Strong ability to anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify needs and opportunities to build reports and dashboards
Develop content for executive level presentations regarding business updates
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Collaborate with peers and data analytics leaders to:
Research best practices in analytics and reporting
Work collaboratively to enhance methodologies and findings
Work closely with leaders of Contact Center, Client Relations, and IT teams

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Business, Finance or related field (MBA preferred)
Related work experience in a data analytics role
Experience working with Sales or Marketing team is a plus
Critical thinking skills with an ability to identify opportunities, clearly and concisely put forward recommendations
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
Report creation and automation
Verbal, written and presentation skills
Natural collaborator and motivated by team success
Self-starter who will thrive in fast-paced work environment
Experience with Looker or other BI tools, SQL, Salesforce is a plus

WHY WORK AT HOMEEQUITY BANK?

Great Environment
HomeEquity Bank offers a hybrid working environment supported with a culture of flexibility – an approach that is unique to each person, and that enables both business and individual needs to be met in a mutually beneficial way.
We pride ourselves in recognizing and celebrating performance, community service, teamwork, and diversity among our employees.

A Dynamic Culture – With People at the Centre
We believe our people make all the difference, and our tireless commitment to inclusivity, professional development, and employee engagement/experience has been recognized through awards including the Globe and Mail’s Report on Business: Canada’s Top Growing Companies 2021 (2 years in a row), Strategy Online Top 10 Brands Awards (at #8) and as a Canadian Mortgage Professional (CMP) 5-Star Mortgage Employer 2022.

Growth and Opportunities
We provide challenging and rewarding careers in a wide variety of fields. We continuously develop and train our employees through professional growth opportunities and on-the-job training. We also encourage our employees to develop professionally and personally though a series of career developing programs including our Educational Assistance Program, designed to reimburse costs related to professional learning and development, as well as providing employees unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning.

Celebrating Great Work and People
We believe in an environment that celebrates success, knowledge, leadership, and work that is inspired by our core values. For these reasons, we have created several programs that make it easy for our employees to say ‘great job’ to their colleagues and leaders.

From our Appreciate! Program to the High Five Award Program and President’s Award Program, we recognize professional achievement with a variety of rewards including points towards gift cards, merchandise, and travel experiences, as well as group RRSP/DPSP contributions and more.

Our Community Leadership Program also recognizes employees who make a positive impact in their communities through volunteer work with a grant for their charity of choice. Additionally, we provide employees with the opportunity to take a paid day off each year to support their favourite local charity.

The Perks
HomeEquity Bank offers a competitive total rewards package that includes the following:

Extended health and dental benefits
Employee & Family Assistance Program
Employer Matched Group Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Share Ownership Plan
Well-being initiatives including: a wellness account; virtual self-care programs and extended mental health benefits
Employee corporate discount for GoodLife Fitness

Stay in the Know

Find out what we’re up to online, and learn more about what makes HomeEquity Bank a great place to work:

LinkedIn
Youtube
Facebook
Chip.ca

Investment Analyst/ Senior Investment Analyst
Why you’ll love this role
The Investment Analyst provides assistance to the Portfolio Management team in managing an investment portfolio to maximize its return within the Investment policy framework and according to the client's objectives.
What you’ll be working on
Collect and analyze industry, company and economic information from a variety of sources including websites, institutional research, corporate reports and industry publication
Review Annual Reports, Quarterlies and Proxy Statements
Conduct regular meetings with management teams of companies both in our portfolio and investment universe
Attend industry and company events to gather information such as investors day, company tours and industry conference
Analyze financial information relating to companies via annual reports, quarterly reports and investor presentations
Write research reports and present to management to assist in key portfolio decision making
Construct stock screens using software such as Bloomberg to filter database of companies to identify potential investment ideas
Organize all available information and data effectively in order to build and maintain spreadsheet models for both valuation and monitoring purposes
Determine both buy and sell targets for companies based on a combination of all the qualitative and quantitative information collected
Present investment ideas to the broader Investment Team
Keep abreast of portfolio strategy, developments in the Canadian and Global economic and political environment and fluctuations in the capital markets
Maintain statistics on the portfolio regarding exposures, company information and valuation parameters
Communicate portfolio positioning ideas to the portfolio managers
Perform other special projects related to investment or theme ideas for the Portfolio managers as required
Market individual fund management capabilities including making presentations to existing and potential clients
What you’ll need to have
1+ years experience in investment research or related positions
Completion of a university degree with courses in finance, investments, economics, mathematics, statistics, ethics
CFA or working toward designation
Well-developed mathematical skills
Strong research, financial modeling, risk management and a thorough understanding of various investment valuation concepts
Clear written and verbal communication skills
Ability to plan tactically or plan strategically
Attention to detail/accuracy
Ability to think logically, analyze and/or solve problems
Beyond the salary
For regular full-time positions, Empire Life offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including:
Benefits plan
Pension plan
Social club
Learning & development
Current career opportunities
Career choices
Get to know us
We’re one of the top 10 life insurance companies in Canada and offer an environment that encourages the pursuit of personal and professional success. At the heart of that success is our focus on customers; we provide protection and financial security for Canadians—with a personal touch.
We acknowledge and reward talent, and support our employees in achieving and exceeding individual and organizational goals. Our goal is to make Empire Life a great place to work, learn and grow, where people can be their true selves, feel they belong and have equal opportunity for growth in their careers. We’re also committed to supporting an inclusive workplace that values diversity.
If you’re looking for an exciting opportunity and the chance to build a career in an innovative and dynamic organization, submit your resume by clicking on Apply.
Empire Life is committed to providing equal access to employment. Empire Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the screening and selection process. If you need this job posting in an alternative format please contact recruitment@empire.ca

The Royal Canadian Mint is hiring a Senior Analyst, Commercial Insights who can thrive in a dynamic and inclusive environment.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Insight and Strategic Planning the Senior Analyst, Commercial Insights is responsible for analyzing complex customer, product, channel and market data in order to provide customer and business insights that inform strategy development. With exceptional data analysis expertise, the Senior Analyst plays a key role in in data driven decision making to improve business profitability, product performance and customer experience
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop analysis, reporting, and system capability solutions, and providing decision makers with actionable business intelligence.
Manipulate and analyze complex, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques such as trend analysis, regression analysis, multi-factor analysis, variance analysis, correlation analysis and stat testing.
Develop approaches to analyze customer behavior, predictive and data modeling frameworks in response to evolving business requirements.
Leverage integrated data along with research insights to provide actionable and strategic recommendations to inform business direction as well as improve performance.
Work closely with finance and production teams to integrate financial, commercial and manufacturing insights and package into integrated plans.
Prepare high quality presentations with insightful, comprehensive and concise insights to different audiences including leadership team (VPs & C level exposure). Ability to translate complex data into simplified yet meaningful insights.
Use web data to build and manage an attribution model to understand marketing and sales activities performance, and provide meaningful insights to optimize and improve ROI.
Build and manage sales and marketing cost attribution model to understand and build targets for ROI by channel and tactic.
Suggest new approaches to analyze data, identify ways to create a 360-degree view of customers that integrates transactional and purchase behavior with consumer research and other data source such as social media and digital data.
Analyze the current organizational data management practices, inclusive of relevant systems, identify gaps and make recommendations on a strategy to grow and expand internal capabilities to ensure the future of customer data management.
Use data mining techniques in combination with superior spreadsheet abilities to develop and implement reporting templates, dashboards for specific initiatives and benchmark reports that provide key performance measurements, evaluate marketing campaign effectiveness, track customer behavior and movements across segments within the database, attribute revenue to the appropriate marketing vehicles/channels and identify other drivers of insight important to growing the business.
Be the Lead contact and primary liaison for collaborating with cross-functional Teams in Sales, IT, Business Intelligence and Marketing as needed to ensure alignment on operational analyses and reporting approaches.
Requirements
University degree in Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or similar or MBA in Data Analytics.
Minimum of 7 years of relevant industry experience analyzing customer transaction data using SQL (Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL) or other analytics databases or statistical packages, such as R, Python, etc..
Experience with web analytics platforms such as Adobe Marketing Cloud or Google Analytics.
Experience in using visualization software such as Tableau or Power BI with proficiency in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) language
Advanced proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, modeling etc.)
Strong analytical mindset and extremely detail-oriented
Self-motivated, energetic, "can-do" attitude in a fast-moving environment
Strong communication skills, written and verbal; ability to present data and its implications in a clear, concise manner to all levels of management
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills, being able to build bridges and confront tough issues that need to be resolved.
Ability to manage priorities across multiple stakeholders
Bilingualism preferred

The health and safety of our employees is a top priority. The Mint has developed significant and rigorous safety protocols to address the COVID-19 pandemic.

At the Mint you will collaborate with a diverse group of people and be a part of an iconic Canadian organization. We pay competitive salary and offer a range of benefits that support employees and their families. The Mint supports its employees by focusing on their growth and development. Selected candidates will be required to complete a background check facilitated by the Mint.

The Mint is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We value diversity and aim to provide an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment, selection and onboarding process to ensure that each candidate is treated respectfully. You are welcome to self identify with one of the four employment equity groups (women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities) in your application.

If you need accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know; we are committed to being an inclusive employer.

Ready to mint your career? Please forward your resume to careers@mint.ca by September 23, 2022. We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

We look forward to receiving your application.

SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.
Job Title: Senior Business Analyst
Location: Mississauga, ON (Hybrid)
Who We Are
At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software.
To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.
What We’re Looking For
Reporting to the Senior Manager Reporting and Analytics, the Senior Business Analyst will get an opportunity to be an integral part of the Business Operations team as they will utilize data and provide insights that will help shape the overall Business Operations Strategy.
Experience with data analysis, mining and reporting including Microsoft Power BI along with a strong understanding of overall business operations is a definite plus.
What’s in it for you?
The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement to our industry-leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun.
The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!
The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading-edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.
What You’ll Do
Assist management in formulating the overall strategic direction by developing Business Operations dashboard(s), compiling key business metrics and reporting on them
Assist in the preparation of the Annual Operating Plan and Quarterly Operating Plan
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets as well as maintain and update databases/data systems by acquiring data from primary or secondary sources
Discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision making by inspecting, cleansing, transforming and modelling data.
Drive deeper business understanding through serving internal customers with strategic and ad-hoc analysis
Engage in benchmarking studies to establish areas of potential operational as well as new process improvements
Experience You’ll Bring
3+ years within a commercial tech industry including quota setting, attainment measuring. Helpful forecasting & reporting
BBA or BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings. Can identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
Ability to gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem-solving situations
In depth knowledge of Excel (75%) and Salesforce (25%) is required, with a specific focus on reporting and dashboards
Understanding of how a relational database works
Ability to interact with a high level of sensitivity, confidentiality, diplomacy and judgment
Proven ability for accuracy and exceptional attention to detail is essential
A collaborative and flexible working style that demonstrates good judgement and execution skills to deliver programs that will be effective in the business and academic worlds
Superior time management skills, including the ability to effectively multi-task, prioritize workflow amid multiple interruptions and work under pressure to meet concurrent deadlines
Self-starter and motivator with the ability to work independently with minimal direction
Excellent interpersonal skills, written and oral communication skills
About SOTI
SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of mobile and IoT management solutions, with more than 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's innovative portfolio of solutions and services provide the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. SOTI extends secure mobility management to provide a total, flexible solution for comprehensive management and security of all mobile devices and connected peripherals deployed in an organization.
At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities.
What are you waiting for? Apply today: https://www.soti.net/careers
Growing our talent is our top priority! Take a look at the job posting below and see what exciting possibilities could be waiting for you next at SOTI.
#LI-SN1
If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.
We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net.
Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

Job_title: Senior Analyst, Risk Modeling and Analytics
Job_Desc:
At MCAN, we are most proud of the team we have built and our team member experience. Our people are our best assets and are made up of respected industry innovators, influencers and big-thinkers. We do things differently than other lenders. Our business isn’t selling mortgages, it’s building relationships.

The #MCANLIFE is shaped around a culture of customer-centricity for both internal and external clients and powered by genuine collaboration. We are a home for talented professionals seeking a more connected career and one that allows them to use more of their skills.

About the opportunity:
Reporting to the Director, Risk Modelling and Analytics (RMAA), the Senior Analyst, RMAA is accountable for supporting the Model Risk Management function within the company. Using large datasets and programming language, this role goes in-depth with data and statistical analyses to provide helpful insight to senior management.

About the Risk and Compliance team:

Work with team members who are high energy and performing
Empowered to make decisions and try new things
Lean focused and continuously looking to enhance and create efficiencies
Participation in learning and growing through both internal and external trainings

What you will be responsible for:

Perform independent validation of models owned by other functions within the organization, such as financial budget model, risk rating models, and cash flow models
Run IFRS 9 program and ECL models
Run ICAAP and stress testing models
Manage policies and documentations related to Model Risk Management and Recovery Plan
Assist Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Credit Risk, and other functions with ad hoc analysis and model development
Key Enterprise Risk Management accountabilities include the support of the Interest Rate and Liquidity Risk Management Frameworks, and the quarterly preparation of the CRO Report for the Risk & Compliance Committee and quarterly Board meetings.
Promote risk awareness and risk culture across the organization

The work experience, skills, education that you bring:

Education:
Bachelor’s degree or post-secondary education related to risk management, data science, statistics, or math preferred
Work Experience:
3-5 years of work experience in data analysis, data science, and modelling
Experience in R or similar programming languages required, such as Python and MATLAB
Exposure to lending practices in financial service industry is an asset
Exposure to IFRS 9, ICAAP, financial budget, or risk rating system is an asset
Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge in statistical analysis (e.g. linear and nonlinear regression) is an asset
Proficiency in working with spreadsheets with large dataset
Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI is an asset
Strong analytical skill set with the ability to demonstrate critical thinking skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate statistical results to senior management
Demonstrated ability to develop trusted collaborative working relationships across multiple stakeholders
Willingness to learn new ideas and skills

The Ministry of Citizens’ Services is a progressive and innovative organization that leads the delivery of high-speed connectivity throughout the province and supports government’s public sector data security and privacy practices to ensure that British Columbians’ personal information is safeguarded. The ministry strives to support excellent service to the public service and citizens of British Columbia as the digital face of government, managing the Province’s real estate assets, technology systems and equipment and by leveraging procurement to increase business opportunities. The ministry delivers high-quality public services to British Columbians through a single-point-of-contact service in urban and rural communities.
The BC Data Service division (BCDS) is responsible for developing statistics about B.C. and provides technical tools and services to maximize data’s use and value for government and the broader public sector - while working closely with partners and clients to ensure that data is used in ways that support better government. BCDS is responsible for implementing BC’s Anti-racism Data Act and is committed to advancing Indigenous data sovereignty.
Specifically, the division delivers several public and ministry-facing programs that support modernization of government, including: DataBC, Data Innovation Program, Data Science Partnership, and BC Stats, the province’s central statistical agency
The Data Systems and Services branch within BCDS is a central service provider and systems manager for data discovery and sharing, data warehousing and publication, API discovery and management, data acquisition, analysis and visualization, digital map, and location services delivery. These systems support a wide range of internal and external clients with critical data replication and access, metadata and governance, data acquisition and analysis, physical address geocoding and routing, API mediation, official place name sharing, geographic bookmarking, and digital map and imagery services delivery.
To deliver these diverse services that support everything from public safety alerting to electronic prescribing, the branch integrates a combination of COTS (commercial off the shelf software), SAAS (software as a service), and FOSS (free and open-source software). To host software the branch employs a wide range of technical infrastructure ranging from physical Linux and Windows servers to Kubernetes clusters on private and public cloud.
As a member of an Agile team, and a contributor to our DevOps Chapter you will help the team to plan and execute the design, development and implementation of solutions that meet client requirements. Provide technical expertise to support application and technology solutions and develop the configuration and installation management plans and scripts for new systems. You will also plan, monitor, and test systems to ensure reliability and recovery objectives are met.

Job Description:
Role Summary
Join a team that is transforming data and analytics at Sun Life Canada. Sun Life’s Client Experience Office (CXO) Analytics area is aggressively enhancing its campaign design and data integration capability with new tools, and most importantly, new talent.
As a member of the CXO Analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in working closely with our business partners to enable digital engagement, understand our client needs in new ways, and ultimately enable a leading client experience.
As a Campaign Designer, you will leverage our vast data, SAS and Big Data capabilities to enable these objectives by designing marketing campaigns and delivering data solutions for our inbound and outbound channels. In joining CXO Analytics, you will be part of one of the fastest growing areas of our business, representing the future of our business and our industry.
What will you do?
Plan, set up, and execute outbound and inbound digital campaigns and real time decision flows in accordance with the strategy and objectives of campaign stakeholders
Work in partnership with internal stakeholders to leverage personas, customer journeys and data strategies to develop and implement marketing automation programs
Gather, document, and help form business requirements, key performance indicators, and other functional and technical requirements
Create high quality client experience through use of digital channels, interactive journeys and triggered engagements
Support stakeholders and third parties throughout the campaign implementation process
Interact frequently with stakeholders including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, content and creative designers
Manage multiple campaigns simultaneously
Some technical writing, report analysis and PowerPoint presentation creation
Understand measurement methodologies, why we need them and when to use them (A/B testing, Test/Control etc.)
Identify process gaps, efficiencies, refinements and establish new process
Gain hands-on experience working with advanced marketing automation platforms, enterprise-level data structures and complex MarTech integrations
Perform extensive data profiling and develop deep understanding of the highly complex data landscape.
Deepen the organizations understanding of client and member level data and provide expert guidance on how best to leverage data to provide actionable business insight
Manage and execute on business data requests ensuring requests are aligned to business priorities and the request fulfillment meets the business needs
Collaborates in an agile team to understand business objectives and develop campaign solutions that deliver best in class, engaging and highly relevant experiences
Liaise with stakeholders across other teams to resolve discrepancies
Manage and execute data requests ensuring requests are aligned to business priorities and the request fulfillment meets the business needs
Support campaign target list generation, analyses, measurement and reporting
What will you need to succeed?
Bachelor Degree in a field with a strong technical core such as Computer Science, Software engineering, Business Analytics, Engineering Science, Statistics, Math, Business Commerce or equivalent working experience
Over 4 years experience in campaign design, data management and a solid understanding of the data needs of marketing, campaigns and business.
Over 5 years experience in SQL programming and database development
Intermediate SAS skills are required
Demonstrated experience in database querying and reporting and developing campaign lists for direct marketing campaigns
The candidates must have relevant experience in the following areas:
Knowledge of Inbound and Outbound campaigns
Knowledge on the data needs for analytics and campaigns
Communication and liaison experience between business, analytics and IT
Competencies:
Solid communication skills – have the ability to explain data complexity to a business audience and explain the complexity of business to the IT audience
Adaptable - maintains effectiveness while managing competing demands, able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events
Organized, takes ownership to meet deadlines and commitments
What will be nice to have?
Related work experience in Campaign execution and operations, marketing automation, digital communications, database marketing and data analysis, decision engines (e.g. SAS, RTDM)
General programming language knowledge and basic application design
Marketing Automation tool experience
Experience in marketing campaign execution, including segmentation and/or list development.
Marketing Automation platform such as Adobe Campaign, Siebel Marketing or Salesforce Pardot
Unique Requirements
The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)
To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html

Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
Great Place to Work® award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022
Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
Flex hours and Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid #LI-Remote
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture

OMERS Products and Technology is looking for Data Analyst passionate about all sides of data analytics and eager to build a data visualizations for our pension Data Engineering team. The individual should be extremely motivated and want to constantly learn and apply new technologies. In this role, the qualified candidate is expected to drive actionable insights.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Interpreting data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports and dashboards
Gathering business requirements and documentation following Agile Practices
Work with Product Managers and Stakeholders to prioritize business data needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Enable business users to bring data-driven insights into their business decisions through reports and dashboards
Understand and communicate complex business concerns and solutions in clear and concise manner
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data as part of each development initiative
Develop Power BI semantic models, dashboards and reports

To succeed in this role, you have:
Must have 5+ years of Hands on experience with Data Modeling, Power BI desktop, Power Query, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL Server
Must have experience working with one or more programming, scripting, and analytical languages such as DAX, MDX, T-SQL, Python, PowerShell
Must have experience building semantic data modeling and publish datasets accordingly
Understanding row level, object level security rules and roles in projects and workspaces is an asset.
Experience working with Power BI external tools such as Tabular Editor, DAX studio and Vertipaq Analyzer is an asset.
Good Understanding of Data Warehouse concepts
Ability to design and build reports, dashboards, data visualizations and analytics using Power BI
Ability to write complex queries using SQL.
Proven Hands on experience with Azure DevOps deployment Pipelines.
Good Knowledge and understanding of Data Governance and Security Measures.
Experience with SSIS is an asset
Good hands on experience working with streaming data.
Have experience in Analyzing the BI needs, interpreting business user requirements and translating them into reports.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and visualize the data.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in an agile environment
A team player and motivated self-starter
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field

Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

About the Opportunity:
The Data and Analytics (DNA) team owns data at Jerry and drives intelligent business decision-making through analytical insights and advanced models. As a Senior Business Analyst, you use data to tell stories and make actionable recommendations to help the business. You will join a team of data engineers, analysts, and data scientists. We are passionate about our mission to build a car ownership super app. We work hard, and we also like to have fun.
How you will be contributing:
Transform and refine raw production data for analytical needs
Develop reports, visualization, and business insights using data
Perform deep-dive analysis on business opportunities and challenges
Partner with other analysts and scientists to build analytical models
About you:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline
Hands-on experience and intermediate knowledge of SQL
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
A few more specifics about you:
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline
3+ years of relevant experience in an analytical role
Hands-on experience with ETL and data warehouse
Knowledge of a modern programming language (Java, Python, etc.)
Experience with analytical and visualization platforms (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
Strong written communication and data presentation skills
About Jerry:
Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That’s why we’re committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.
Jerry is taking processes that haven’t substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners’ needs.
Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 2M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.
Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing.

EA Sports is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world with top-selling video game franchises, award-winning interactive technology, and cross-platform digital experiences. We create connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sports through industry-leading video games including FIFA soccer, Madden NFL football, NHL hockey, UFC, and more.
What you'll do on our team:
As a Senior Analyst in the NHL Analytics Team reporting to an Analytics Manager, your main focus is delivering insights that inform decisions related to product strategy, forecasting, feature selection and in-game economies working with Producers and Brand Managers.
We're looking for a curious person with a passion for diving into data to uncover insights and understand how our players are engaging. Your analysis will improve product acquisition, retention, and monetization. You’ll not only be a data explorer and modeler, but also a storyteller that influences bold decisions for NHL’s development team.
Examples of projects you may work on include feature assessments, campaign reviews, forecasting revenue, and implementing machine learning models to uncover new relationships.
Responsibilities:
Evaluate experiments and find new opportunities to explore data to improve the player experience, improve the product, allow real-time promotional decisions, and drive player engagement.
Lead analytics delivery for NHL in weekly meetings and communication to Executives.
Establish segmentation groupings and build propensity models that predict churn, engagement, and other user behaviors.
Work with partners to implement data collection and BI in an iterative way so that our knowledge continues to evolve.
Maintain forecast models for Live game modes and other digital products, working with game producers, marketing, and finance.
Model trends in our data to predict the ways in which new content and campaigns will affect the in-game economy, its performance, and our players.
Receive questions from our partners, determine the best ways that our data can help answer them, and provide those insights through dashboards, reports, or presentations.
Present analyses and findings to our partners in a clear and understandable way.
Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics, or a related field at a minimum; a master’s degree in one of these fields is a significant plus
5+ years of experience in analytics using data to help guide decisions
Excellent SQL skills querying complex data sets
Proficiency in analyzing large datasets in both a spreadsheet program and in a programmatic analysis tool (e.g. Python, R)
Experience in practical applications of statistical modeling (e.g. multivariate regression, predictive modeling, clustering, machine learning)
Experience delivering analyses and dashboards using data visualization applications (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)

But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need creative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

A home is the biggest investment most people make, and yet, it doesn't come with a manual. That's why we're building the only app homeowners need to effortlessly manage their homes — knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. With Thumbtack, millions of people care for what matters most, and pros earn billions of dollars through our platform. And as one of the fastest-growing companies in a $500B industry — we must be doing something right.

We are driven by a common goal and the deep satisfaction that comes from knowing our work supports local economies, helps small businesses grow, and brings homeowners peace of mind. We're seeking people who continually put our purpose first: advocating for pros and customers, embracing change, and choosing teamwork every day.

At Thumbtack, we're creating a new era of home care. If making an impact and the chance to do good inspires you, join us. Imagine what we'll build together.

About the Growth Operations Team

The Growth Operations team is a tight-knit group charged with helping to drive revenue through the sales team and improving pro Long Term Value (LTV) through the success team, all at the best ROI possible. We provide actionable insights to the sales and success teams and leadership, drive efficiencies in workflows and processes, and facilitate a smooth process for our pros to help them be successful on our platform. We collaborate across a variety of teams-from analytics to product to engineering to support!

About the Role

The Sr. Growth Operations Manager, Pro Acquisition is a people leader role responsible for leading and executing Pro acquisition strategies in a hyper-growth environment. In this role you will be responsible for discovering and driving scalable pro acquisition funnels end to end on the Pro-side of Thumbtack's two-sided marketplace. Key deliverables are to define scalable processes, integrate technology, and deliver both quantity and quality of leads needed for Thumbtack sales teams.

Responsibilities

The team is highly interdisciplinary, encompassing a variety of skill sets including project management, operations analysts and lead generation specialists. In this role, you'll report to the Sr. Manager of Expansion Operations. You will be supporting National Ops teams to architect ETLs, dashboards and processes that help drive efficiencies and share insights across our sales funnel. More specifically, you will:

Gather, analyze and model data for potential and existing pro business expansion- (SQL/Tableau)
Analyze process issues and bottlenecks and to make improvements
Create reports, dashboards and visualizations to understand business performance
Test business processes and recommend improvements that drive revenue leading to improved ROI
Own the production and evolution of key performance KPIs like Revenue, ROAS, LTV,CAC, conversion and churn.
Collaborate with business partners to develop technical /business approaches and new or enhanced technical tools
Work closely with our partners in sales, marketing, operations, product - be a good partner in the experimentation process from hypothesis design and supporting data, to audience selection through execution and analysis
Must-Have Qualifications

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

BA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science
3+ years working experience in SQL, business intelligence tools and Salesforce CRM
Experience synthesizing results, forming recommendations, and delivering to relevant internal stakeholders
2+ years of experience supporting National Accounts and/or Enterprise Sales team(s)
Portfolio of projects focused on QA, efficiency gains and/or process improvement.
Strong communicator with proven experience successfully working with cross functional teams in a fast-paced, high growth environment
Comfortable with adapting and adjusting to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change
Nice-to-Have Qualifications
Strong marketplace experience
A good command of statistics & testing business methodologies
Expertise dealing with third party vendors and retrieving data from external sources.
Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Canada or the Philippines*. When it is safe to gather, we will begin to host in-person events on a regular basis. Remote employees will be expected to travel occasionally for these events to a Thumbtack library or offsite team-building location. In cities with 5+ employees, we are establishing local communities, where employees can gather for local events. Additionally, employees in the San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto and Manila areas will have opt-in access to communal workspace at one of our Thumbtack libraries. We always prioritize the health and safety of our employees. Currently, participation in these events and Thumbtack library use are optional. Both require employees to be fully vaccinated.

About SE Health
SE Health is a not-for-profit social enterprise that shares its knowledge, provides the best care, and helps each client to realize their most meaningful goals for health and wellbeing. Established in 1908 by four pioneering nurses, we have worked with purpose for more than a century to bring hope and happiness, and forever impact how people live and age at home. Today, our 8,000+ team members nationwide provide care in more places and ways than ever before, bringing health to life for over 20,000 Canadians every day.
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Sr Business Systems Analyst’s role is to provide support for the planning, design, development, and launch of efficient business systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This includes leading the analysis, specification, and validation of business requirements through interviewing stakeholders to understand the technology solutions they need. Gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, requests for proposal and systems requirements. The Sr Business Systems Analyst is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT system investments.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Application Support
Work with the business & internal support teams to resolve production issues for assigned applications.
Generate statistics and write reports for customers and/or team members
Write SQL scripts to address gaps in functionality and/or performance of applications as necessary
Support the migration of new software programs across different phases of the project (DEV to UAT)
Lead functional testing efforts for enhancements, fixes, and upgrades when a QA resource is not assigned.
Liaise within the team for efficient implementation of software fixes, new software products or systems and for resolution of any issues
Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines
Create Process Efficiencies and Project Support
Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures to identify process improvements
Define, develop, and document business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements and functional specifications to ensure that they are correctly interpreted.
Conduct interviews/client meetings to gather user requirements via workshops, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Lead design sessions and prototyping new solutions
Develop an understanding of existing business processes and recommend changes that leverage best usage of the application
Design and monitor software tests on new and existing programs when a QA resource is not assigned.
Maintain appropriate Change Management processes for Production changes.
Conduct research sessions in prototyping new solutions to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow.
Create systems models, specifications, and diagrams to assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these to the business stakeholders and system programmers.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
Facilitate the purchase and implementation of Cloud-based and/or vendor solutions by assisting in defining specifications, preparing Request for Proposal (RFP), solution evaluation and selection.
Work with the programmers, users, and other IT staff to test solutions. Review and evaluate test results and ensure corrections are made and re-tested as appropriate.

Planning
Provide input to defining project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation
Be willing to engage in life-long learning with respect to professional development, training and courses of study

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or other technically relevant degree
Minimum 8 – 10+ years of Analysis experience providing project implementation and support in a structured systems development environment.
Significant experience supporting the development and implementation of web-based software solutions, on both functional and technical levels, as well as system interfaces to vendor and/or Cloud-based solutions.
Proven knowledge of SQL Query language
Experience managing data quality and governance issues and requirements
Proven experience in requirements analysis, system design proposals, cost/benefit analysis and testing in support of solution development.
Demonstrated ability to work with clients, end-users and other IT professionals, specifically in building relationships and managing expectations.
Experience in the operation and analysis of database hardware, software, and standards, as well as data retrieval methodologies.
Demonstrated project management skills.
Experience in defining, implementing and/or enhancing requirements gathering processes and templates.
EHR and Health informatics experience is an asset.

Skills/ Competencies:
Ability to conduct research into production issues
Exceptional attention to detail with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong customer service skills
Working knowledge of ITSM/ITIL process analysis and improvement (Service Catalogue, Change Incident, Request, Problems etc.)
Highly motivated with the ability to independently produce quality work
Flexible and adaptable in learning and understanding new technologies & processes
Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work in a team oriented, collaborative environment
Ability to work flexible hours

Our top priority is the health and safety of our clients, their families and our staff.
