Job_Desc:
Are you excited about the prospect of joining a startup organization at the ground floor? Interested in being a part of the changing skies in Canada and beyond? Want to work with world-class leaders who have extensive industry know-how? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
Lynx Air is seeking a Schedule Planning Analyst for our Commercial division to join our rapidly expanding, dynamic team!
WHO WE ARE:
Lynx Air is Canada’s newest ultra-affordable airline, on a mission to make air travel accessible for all. With airfare sky-high in Canada, we give value-seeking travellers an affordable, safe and customer-first flying experience.
Lynx has taken to the skies, piloting our brand-new fleet of Boeing 737 MAX planes to select Canadian destinations. Our mission is to bring safe, affordable, low-cost air travel to millions of Canadians and we are excited to be building our team that will help us get there!
Backed by significant financial investment from a group of prominent Canadian and American investors, we are poised to change the Canadian airline landscape. Combining the financial strength of our talented partners with the skills and energy of Canadians like you, we can bring the best practices of the aviation industry to Canada!
WHAT THE ROLE ENTAILS:
Reporting to the Network Planning Manager, the Schedule Planning Analyst will be responsible for developing, modifying, and publishing flight schedules taking into consideration the crew and maintenance requirements of the aircraft. A vital role in the organization, this position will drive commercial results while meeting the operational needs to run an on-time airline.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Responsible for the management of Lynx Air's entire flight schedules including published and seasonal schedules
Act as a primary user of the Flight Scheduling System (FSS) and Passenger Services System (PSS) to maintain and manage the process of route scheduling and maintenance
Partner with internal departments (including Finance, Operation Control, as well as Technical, Flight, and Airport Operations), the executive team, and external stakeholders such as airports and airport service providers
Lead the schedule review process in the commercial operations team
Analyze & optimize schedule performance for commercial and operational effectiveness
Assist the operations support team with accommodation of IROP and ad-hoc flight scheduling
Generate and publish schedule files for transfer to the Flight Operating System and PSS
Develop written reports and presentations for the commercial team as required
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE:
3+ years of previous airline experience in a commercial aircraft scheduling capacity
Advanced digital literacy, including proficiency in FSS and PSS software
Highly proficient in MS Office applications, particularly Excel (including vba, macros, and pivot tables)
Ability to logically structure analysis of complex issues using an analytical framework and develop creative solutions to business challenges
Strong time management and multitasking skills while working with multiple competing deadlines
Ability to communicate clearly, confidently, and persuasively with senior management using verbal, written, and presentation skills
Collaborative, driven, creative, and innovative mindset
Passion for problem-solving, creative thinking, and continuous improvement
Post-secondary education in business, economics, or statistics preferred
WHAT YOU WILL GET FROM US:
Industry competitive salary
The chance to be part of building something from the ground up. Aggressive growth plans of the organization mean there is no limit to how far you can grow your career with the organization
An environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance
Open and collaborative work environment. You bring your great ideas, and we will put them to action
Comprehensive benefits and HSA
The opportunity to travel where we fly
 Here at Lynx Air, we're an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that places value on the strength that diversity brings to the workplace and that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any kind. Our employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We encourage all applicants who meet the requirements for the role to apply.
Interviews will be commencing right away, so don’t hesitate and apply today to be part of Canada’s changing aviation landscape! Cover letters are not required.
